page.title: 17EDGEWELL FARM, PRUDHOE
page.content:
Mr. Lowdon owns 150 acres of farm land. He has owned it since 1928 but does not known how old it is. He uses 25 acres for wheat, 55 acres for barley, 1 acre for potatoes, 2 acres for turnips. He uses the rest of the land for hay and pasture. Mr. Lowdon said that the amount of land he owns will stay the same in the future. The farm is run by Mr. Lowdon's son and himself. They do mixed farming because if one crop doesn't make as much money as expected there is always another crop to sell. He buys two different types of cow charolais and heifers (which cost about Â£250 each).
Footnote: Edgewell Farm is to the north of the A695 Halfway, Prudhoe.
